title: China-Based Auditors Pose Risks for U.S. Companies, Study Shows
sub_head: The probability that accounting problems will occur increases as Chinese firms perform a larger share of an audit, say three professors
body:
Some 200 Chinese companies are under threat to be booted from U.S. stock exchanges because they use China-based auditors whose work canâ€™t be inspected by U.S. regulators. The move is designed to protect U.S. investors, lawmakers say.
More than 130 U.S. companies use these same Chinese auditors for significant parts of their audits, according to research by three accounting professors.
